saberes: A. Communication
LE.03.A.1. Self-confidence. The error as an instrument of improvement.
LE.03.A.2. Basic strategies for the comprehension, planning and production of short, simple and contextualised oral, written and multimodal texts.
LE.03.A.3. Knowledge, skills and attitudes that allow initiation in mediation activities in basic everyday situations.

LE.03.A.4. Basic communicative functions appropriate to the field and context: greeting, saying goodbye, introducing and introducing oneself; describe people, objects, and places; situate events in time; locate objects, people and places in space; request and exchange information on everyday issues; describe routines; give directions and instructions; Express ownership and quantity.

LE.03.A.5. Contextual models and basic discursive genres in the comprehension, production and co-production of oral, written and multimodal, short and simple, literary and non-literary texts: characteristics and recognition of the context, organization and structuring according to the internal structure.

LE.03.A.6. Basic linguistic units and meanings associated with such units such as expression of the entity and its properties, quantity and number, space and spatial relations, time, affirmation, negation, question and exclamation, elementary logical relations.

LE.03.A.7. Basic vocabulary of interest to students, related to personal identification, close interpersonal relationships, nearby places and environments, leisure and free time, healthy habits, affective-sexual health education, daily life, highlighting the importance of sustainability and environmental care.
LE.03.A.8. Basic sound, stress, rhythmic and intonation patterns, and general communicative functions associated with these patterns.

LE.03.A.9. Basic spelling conventions and meanings associated with formats and graphic elements. LE.03.A.10. Basic conversational conventions and strategies, in synchronous or asynchronous format, to start, maintain and end communication, take and give the floor, ask for and give clarifications and explanations, compare and contrast, collaborate, etc.
LE.03.A.11. Resources for learning and strategies for the guided search for information in analog and digital media.
LE.03.A.12. Intellectual property of the sources consulted and content used.

LE.03.A.13. Basic analogue and digital tools in common use for oral, written and multimodal comprehension, production and co-production, and virtual platforms for educational interaction, cooperation and collaboration (virtual classrooms, videoconferences, collaborative digital tools, etc.) for learning, communication and the development of projects with speakers or students of the foreign language.
B. Multilingualism.

LE.03.B.1. Strategies and techniques to compensate for communication deficiencies in order to respond effectively to a specific need, despite the limitations derived from the level of competence in the foreign language and in the other languages of the own linguistic repertoire.

LE.03.B.2. Basic strategies in common use to identify, organize, retain, recover and use linguistic units (lexicon, morphosyntax, sound patterns, etc.) from the comparison of the languages and varieties that make up the personal linguistic repertoire.
LE.03.B.3. Strategies and basic tools of common use for self-assessment and peer-assessment, analogue and digital, individual and cooperative.
LE.03.B.4. Vocabulary and basic expressions in common use to understand statements about communication, language, learning and communication and learning tools (metalanguage).
LE.03.B.5. Elementary comparison between languages based on elements of the foreign language and other languages: origin and relationships.
C. Interculturality

LE.03.C.1. The foreign language as a means of communication and relationship with people from other countries, as a way of accessing new information and as a means of learning about different cultures and ways of life, as well as a means of transmitting values of Andalusian culture.
LE.03.C.2. Positive assessment and interest in establishing contacts and communicating through different means with speakers or students of the foreign language.
LE.03.C.3. Frequently used basic cultural patterns of the foreign language.

LE.03.C.4. Basic and habitual sociocultural and sociolinguistic aspects related to customs, daily life and interpersonal relationships, basic social conventions in common use, non-verbal language, linguistic courtesy and digital etiquette typical of countries where the foreign language is spoken.
LE.03.C.5. Basic strategies of common use to understand and appreciate linguistic, cultural and artistic diversity, based on ecosocial and democratic values.
LE.03.C.6. Strategies for detecting uses discrimination of verbal and non-verbal language.
criteriosEvaluacion: 1.1.a. Recognize and interpret the global meaning, as well as specific words and phrases of short and simple oral, written and multimodal texts on frequent and everyday topics of personal relevance and areas close to their experience, as well as literary texts appropriate to the level of development of the students , expressing in an understandable, clear way and in standard language through different supports.

1.2.a. Select and apply, in a guided way, appropriate strategies and knowledge in daily communicative situations and relevant to students, in order to capture the overall meaning and process explicit information in various texts.

2.1.a. Participate orally in simple and brief conversations, previously prepared, using, in a guided way, basic resources of verbal and non-verbal language, as well as simple structures related to the foreign language.

2.2.a. Get started, with help, in the writing of short and simple texts, trying to adjust to the communicative situation, through the use of simple tools, both analogical and digital, as well as the help of structures and basic vocabulary on everyday topics adapted to their experience more close.

2.3.a. Select and apply, in a guided way, knowledge and strategies to prepare and produce texts appropriate to the communicative intentions, the contextual characteristics and the textual typology, using, with help, physical or digital resources depending on the task and the needs of each moment .

3.1.a. Participate in brief and simple dialogues and conversations on topics close to their experience, through various supports, reproducing sound patterns of repetition, with basic intonation and rhythm and using their own non-verbal language resources, favoring the ability to show empathy and respect for the Linguistic courtesy and digital etiquette and valuing the needs, ideas and motivations of the interlocutors.

3.2.a. Select, organize and use, in a guided way and in everyday situations, elementary strategies to greet, say goodbye and introduce oneself; formulate and answer simple questions and express simple and contextualized messages.

4.1.a. Understand and transmit, in a guided way, and with the help of various resources and supports, essential information from short and simple oral texts, in different contexts in which it is necessary to attend to diversity, valuing the interlocutors with empathy and respect and languages used and taking an interest in understanding problems in their closest environment.

4.2.a. Identify and distinguish, in a guided way, basic and simple strategies in order to facilitate the understanding and production of information and its communicative intention, using, with help, some physical or digital resources appropriate to their own needs at all times.
5.1.a. Compare and contrast the similarities and differences between different languages, reflecting in a progressively autonomous way on very basic aspects of how they work.

5.2.a. Progressively autonomously use the knowledge and strategies to improve their ability to communicate and learn the foreign language, with the support of other participants and analog and digital media.

5.3.a. Register and use, in a guided way, the progress and basic difficulties in the foreign language learning process, recognizing the aspects that help to improve and carrying out self-evaluation and peer-evaluation activities, such as those proposed in the European Language Portfolio (PEL). ) or in a learning journal.

6.1.a. Act with respect in intercultural situations, building links between different languages and cultures, and showing rejection of any type of discrimination, prejudice and stereotype in daily and habitual communicative contexts.

6.2.a. Accept and respect the linguistic, cultural and artistic diversity typical of countries where the foreign language is spoken as a source of personal enrichment, showing interest in understanding basic cultural and linguistic elements that promote sustainability and democracy.
6.3.a. Select and apply, in a guided way, basic strategies to understand and appreciate the significant aspects of linguistic, cultural and artistic diversity.
